summary: This document is a chain of emails from June 27, 2020, discussing an extortion threat and harassment directed at an unnamed individual. The emails detail emergency disclosure requests to Google that traced the threats to IP addresses in Iran, and include a forwarded threatening email demanding a bitcoin ransom. The correspondence involves law enforcement and legal personnel discussing resource allocation and security recommendations.

persons.name: N=aa
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain discussing the threat investigation and security measures.

events.title: Extortion Threat Email
events.description: An email containing a threat demanding 2.5 bitcoins within 8 hours, with threats of violence against a child, sent from an individual claiming to be in New York with a brother in Iran.

events.title: Emergency Disclosure Request to Google
events.description: An emergency disclosure request was sent to Google, with results showing the originating IP address for the threatening emails was located in Iran.

keyFacts: Threatening emails demanding a bitcoin ransom were traced via Google emergency disclosure requests to IP addresses located in Iran.
The threat included a specific demand for 2.5 bitcoins within 8 hours and violent threats against a child.
Law enforcement had previously increased patrols around a residence due to a countdown threat, but nothing occurred.
The email chain suggests frustration over continued resource allocation to an individual who does not follow investigative advice.
A recommendation was made for the individual to hire a private security firm instead of relying on law enforcement resources.
